sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Fluidized Bed Coater for coating tablets, granules, or pellets with functional coatings using bottom spray, top spray, or tangential spray technology.
sections.scope: Applicable to fluidized bed coating activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the equipment is installed in a clean area with proper environmental controls.
Verify all utilities including electricity, compressed air, and ventilation are connected.
Check that the product bowl, Wurster column (if applicable), and filters are clean.
Install appropriate spray nozzles based on coating type and configuration.
Power ON the fluidized bed coater and initialize control system.
Set process parameters including inlet air temperature, air volume, and spray rate.
Load tablets, granules, or pellets into the product bowl.
Start the blower to establish fluidization of the product.
Adjust air flow to achieve proper fluidization pattern without product loss.
Allow the product bed to reach set temperature before starting spray.
Prepare coating solution ensuring proper mixing and uniform consistency.
Connect peristaltic pump to coating solution container.
Set atomization air pressure and spray rate parameters.
Start spraying coating solution at low rate initially.
Monitor product temperature and adjust inlet temperature to maintain balance.
Observe coating uniformity and adjust spray pattern if needed.
Continue coating process until desired weight gain is achieved.
Take samples periodically to check coating thickness and uniformity.
After coating completion, stop spraying but continue drying with heated air.
Perform final drying phase to remove residual moisture from coating.
Cool the product gradually before unloading.
Discharge coated product into appropriate containers.
Clean spray nozzles, product bowl, and filters thoroughly.
Document all coating parameters, weight gain, and quality observations in the record.
precautions: Maintain proper product temperature to prevent sticking or agglomeration.
Balance spray rate with drying capacity to avoid over-wetting.
Ensure proper fluidization throughout the coating process.
Clean spray nozzles regularly to prevent clogging.
Monitor pressure drop across filters and clean when necessary.
Avoid product loss through exhaust by proper air flow adjustment.
Use appropriate atomization pressure for desired droplet size.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves, mask, and protective clothing.
Handle coating solvents in well-ventilated areas.
Follow cleaning validation protocols for product changeover.
